content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Coal Mining Setup at position(41.0, -82.0)
Consists of:
- Burner mining drill mining coal
- Input chest (iron-chest) at (41.5, -83.5) containing coal
- Output chest (wooden-chest) at (41.5, -80.5) containing coal
- Additional storage chest (iron-chest) at (41.5, -84.5) containing coal

### Iron Smelting System around position(46.0, -80.0)
Consists of:
- Two stone furnaces at (45.0, -81.0) and (47.0, -81.0)
- Central iron ore input chest (wooden-chest) at (45.5, -79.5)
- Two input inserters:
  - First burner inserter at (44.5, -79.5) feeding first furnace
  - Second burner inserter at (46.5, -79.5) feeding second furnace
- Output inserter (burner-inserter) at (48.5, -80.5)
- Output storage chest (wooden-chest) at (49.5, -80.5) containing iron plates

Additional storage chests:
- Wooden chest at (45.5, -84.5)

ERROR TIPS

### Entity Placement Conflicts
- Before placing entities, verify the target location is clear of other entities
- Multiple attempts were made to place inserters at occupied positions (44.5, -80.5), (45.0, -80.0), (45.5, -80.5)
- When rebuilding/modifying existing structures, remove conflicting entities first

### Resource Management
- Mining drill has stopped due to full output chest - implement a system to regularly empty output chests
- Ensure proper fuel management for burner devices

### Structure Design
- When designing automated systems, ensure proper spacing between components to allow for inserter placement
- Plan entity layouts carefully to avoid placement conflicts

NAMESPACE

Functions:
- place_entity(): Places entities on the map
  Success: When target location is clear
  Failure: When location is occupied by another entity

Important Variables:
- first_inserter: BurnerInserter - Controls input for first furnace
- second_inserter: BurnerInserter - Controls input for second furnace
